oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A simplex-like algorithm for fisher markets
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ADSUL, B
BABU, CS
GARG, J
MEHTA, R
SOHONI, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We propose a new convex optimization formulation for the Fisher market problem with linear utilities. Like the Eisenberg-Gale formulation, the set of feasible points is a polyhedral convex set while the cost function is non-linear; however, unlike that, the optimum is always attained at a vertex of this polytope. The convex cost function depends only on the initial endowments of the buyers. This formulation yields an easy simplex-like pivoting algorithm which is provably strongly polynomial for many special cases.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 3rd International Symposium on Algorithmic Game Theory,Athens, GREECE,OCT 18-20, 2010
